DOCNAME: CASE OF M. TOSUN v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested on suspicion of attempting to undermine the constitutional order , an offence under LAW of LAW then in force . He was subsequently transferred to a prison where he was detained pending the introduction of criminal proceedings against him .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor at ORG filed an indictment with that court , charging the applicant and a number of other persons with the above - mentioned offence .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( hereafter “ the trial court ” ) found the applicant guilty as charged and sentenced him to life imprisonment . The applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment and criminal proceedings against the applicant recommenced before the trial court .

CARDINAL . Following the abolition of ORG , ORG took over the case . On DATE the applicant was released on bail from prison where he had been detained since DATE . The retrial is still pending before ORG . According to the information provided by the applicant , the most recent hearing was held on DATE .
